Libraries.​primitive

A library that leverages mesh functions to create primitive 3D shapes.

Functions here usually have counterparts in the render library and IMesh metatable.

Functions
Cylinder
function primitive.Cylinder(
iMesh,
height,
radius1,
radius2,
steps,
color
)

Generates a capped right circular cylinder or cone based on the arguments passed.

Parameters
IMesh iMesh

The mesh to write to. Can be omitted if you're drawing a dynamic mesh.

number height

The height of the cylinder. A negative value will make it cylinder render inside out.

number radius1

The radius of the bottom face of the cylinder. A value of 0 removes the face entirely.

number radius2

The radius of the top face of the cylinder. A value of 0 removes the face entirely.

number steps

The amount of steps. This controls the quality of the cylinder. Higher values will lower performance significantly.

Color? color

The color to draw the cylinder with. Default: color_white
